title: AI-driven 3D Spatial Transcriptomics
author: Cristina Almagro-Perez (Mass General Brigham, Harvard Medical School), Andrew H. Song (Mass General Brigham, Harvard Medical School), Luca Weishaupt (Mass General Brigham, Harvard Medical School), Ahrong Kim (Pusan National University), Guillaume Jaume (Mass General Brigham, Harvard Medical School), Drew F.K. Williamson (Emory University School of Medicine), Konstantin Hemker (University of Cambridge), ..., Faisal Mahmood (Mass General Brigham, Harvard Medical School)
relevance_why: The methodology presented can be applied to audio-related tasks involving spatial data interpretation and analysis. Understanding 3D spatial relationships and predictive modeling may inspire novel approaches in audio generation, particularly in the context of immersive audio experiences.
background: The task involves creating a comprehensive 3D representation of tissue architecture and gene expression to better understand intratumoral heterogeneity in cancer tissues.
contribution: This paper introduces VOlumetrically Resolved Transcriptomics EXpression (VORTEX) to solve the limitations of existing 3D spatial transcriptomics methods, achieving scalable and high-throughput volumetric gene expression predictions with minimal tissue sampling.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods in 3D spatial transcriptomics require extensive tissue sectioning and are not scalable or compatible with non-destructive imaging.
technical_comparison.novelty: VORTEX utilizes a deep learning framework to predict volumetric gene expression from minimal 2D spatial transcriptomics data, significantly reducing costs and processing time.

key_innovation: VORTEX leverages pretraining on diverse 3D morphology–transcriptomic pairs followed by fine-tuning, enabling effective prediction of 3D gene expression profiles.
real_world_impact: The framework has the potential to accelerate biomarker discovery and enhance our understanding of complex tissues in biomedical research and personalized medicine.

new_terms.spatial transcriptomics: **Spatial transcriptomics** is a method that provides spatially resolved gene expression profiles within tissue samples, enabling researchers to correlate molecular features with tissue architecture.

open_sourcing: Interactive 3D ST volumes can be accessed at https://vortex-demo.github.io/
